title: Van Morrison and Neil Young's new albums prove they're still extraordinary talents
text:
Some might say I’m an old white guy,” Neil Young drawls over a grungy guitar riff. That’s not about to stop the 73-year-old Canadian rock star expressing his contempt for other “old white guys trying to kill mother nature” on the magnificently belligerent She Showed Me Love. This 13-minute stomp of disgust is so ramshackle it sounds like he might have angrily pressed “record” before he had even finished teaching his band the chord changes.

To be fair, Young has been warning us that mother nature is on the run since the Seventies, and the situation hasn’t exactly improved since then. There is an apocalyptic urgency to Colorado, Young’s 39th solo album – his 10th this decade. Long established as...
description: Some might say I’m an old white guy,” Neil Young drawls over a grungy guitar riff.
